Hi with the new cPf scheme  is it is better to quickly transfer money from OA to SA to hit the FRS early? Or it is better to slowly build the FRS with the $8000 top up to earn tax relief? What are the views?

Just an update  have reached out to grab to clarify. There is a pre authorization hold on funds where grab charged to ur credit card an amount larger than the actual cab fare and they will reverse this hold of funds upon the confirmation of the ride. The above scenarios attached are not applicable to me which is strange. I have been using the same credit card for grab rides via their apps and never encountered such instances.

I am not sure about Malaysia's credit card but I had one from Maybank FC Barcelona visa signature card that gives small cash rebate and no annual fees. You can compare Malaysia and singapore ones with same card. I personally feel the credit cards in Singapore is better and way more competitive due to strong sgdEver since I knew I spend with Malaysia's credit card in Malaysia and didn't get reward well. It's better use those cash cards with good currency conversion rate (I.e. Trust card) or you use those singapores credit cards can earn better miles in overseas.
Sure Dave  thanks a lot for the info. So preferably to apply Maybank credit card. And obviously I can use it in Malaysia. But how's the FX rate? Do they incur that?

I think you misunderstood. I didn't say prefer to apply maybank credit card. You still need to research and compare. Also to each of its own and depending on your preference. For local credit cards there will be some hidden FX fees you will need to bear but I think due to strong sgd. I can bear with it. That's why many people are encouraging to use those cash cards  to name a few  trust card etc. And I think most credit cards issued in Singapore can be used in oversea as long as your setting made it can be used in overseas.Iirc  to apply credit card in Malaysia seems like you need to show your income statement in Malaysia (being employed in Malaysia). Not sure they will accept you who is a foreigner and employed in Singapore with less vested interest to apply credit card in Malaysia. You can enquire and look at their website for requirements and tnc etc. I got the credit card in Malaysia when I applied is when I am working in Malaysia before.
